title: Is it possible for a home filled with smart technology to be hacked easily? - Quora

response.answer_text: Please don’t use default passwords for your router and wifi…most of the stuff you hear out there people have just left the admin user as the router login with a blank password…same with the wifi. A very well secured network (change the passwords to something complex instead of the defaults) a network is more difficult to hack. If you get a hacker that hacks you after you have established a better security (change the password) then there is something he/she wants….trust me there is nothing you have a hacker really wants, unless it is a secret no one else has, there are more important people to hack.

Yes, the more IoT devices, or devices you have connected to your network allow for more entry points for hackers. Each smart device is one of those entry points., therefore the more you have the more ways there are for a hacker to get in. Visit Omega Computer Services’ blog, YouTube channel, and the Geek Freaks Podcast for more cybersecurity resources.
